pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw:
Commit 11c0c9b adds support for both cases, but I'm not a fan of it since when the `<sdf>` tag is missing, SDF prints misleading error messages when nothing wrong happened:

~~~
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:341] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
~~~

This is coming from the `sdf::readString` function. I'm not sure if this is the recommended way of checking whether an SDF string is valid or not. Also see [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/151/trying-to-parse-an-invalid-file-gives-urdf) SDFormat issue.

If there isn't a better way to check for valid SDF, I was thinking of just using TinyXML. Thoughts?
content.html:
Commit 11c0c9b adds support for both cases, but I'm not a fan of it since when the <sdf> tag is missing, SDF prints misleading error messages when nothing wrong happened:

Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:341] parse as old deprecated model file failed.

This is coming from the sdf::readString function. I'm not sure if this is the recommended way of checking whether an SDF string is valid or not. Also see this SDFormat issue.

If there isn't a better way to check for valid SDF, I was thinking of just using TinyXML. Thoughts?
